titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Fire Department journals 1985.024
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:23 +0000.

did.abstract: The Brooklyn Fire Department journals span the period 1899 to 1904 and are housed in two bound volumes. The order journal includes of memoranda of fire chiefs, and the company journal includes specific time entries and departures of the firemen, as well as a time schedule of the house watchman for Engine Company No. 54.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Interested researchers should also consult the Brooklyn Firefighting collection (call number 1989.006).
